name: interchannel
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
geology between passages for water, especially rivers or areas of sea: This allowed floodwater from the channel to flow into an adjacent interchannel area. Sand sedimentation on interchannel islands was the product of flash floods. Related word
channel noun (PASSAGE)
electronics between different electric circuits that are paths for signals : inter-channel audio signals The control through virtual microphones captures inter-channel time differences, in a way that is familiar to sound recording engineers. Related word
channel noun (ELECTRICAL)
media between ranges of frequencies for broadcasting radio and television signals: Some interchannel interference was detected. TV viewing in those days meant interchannel drift, picture rolling, and all sorts of other odd reception peculiarities. Related word
channel noun (BROADCASTING)
